titleStmt.title: C. S. McConnell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5524

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Your petitioners, citizens of Boyd County and State of Kentucky, would respectfully represent, that at the November Term 1863 of the Boyd Circuit Court that Henry Kahne a citizen of this county was indicted for the offence of keeping a "Ten Pin Alley" and was fined by a jury the sum of One Hundred Dollars, We would respectfully represent that the said Kahne, is a German, unacquainted with laws of our state,- that said Kahne had erected the said "Ten Pin Alley" on his own premises, for his private uses- but other persons used the Ten pin Alley, without the knowledge or Consent upon and bet small sums upon their games on said "Ten Pin Alley" The said Kahne, has wholly destroyed the said "Ten Pin Alley" where he was informed ^by neighbors^ that he was compromised by said persons, who had bet upon the games on said "Alley' We would respectfully pray your Excellency to remit the said fine, as we are personally acquainted with the said Henry Kahne, and are fully satisfied, that he would not violate the laws of our State knowingly- but being a German and unacquainted with our laws- he was imposed upon by persons as above stated

no reason for executive clemency
Thos. E. Bramlette
